{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=EVG2000 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date=2011 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U12H154T80 |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,dsl modem,analog phone gateway |fcc_id= |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=2.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM6369 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu1_cores= |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX29GL128ELT2I-90G |fla1_num= |ram1=32 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5DS8M16FS-5T |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4322 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53115 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags=VDSL2 |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=20:4E:7F |oui_eth=20:4E:7F }} '''BigPond Velocity Home Network Gateway'''
[http://www.netgear.com/service-provider/products/routers-and-gateways/gigabit-ethernet-routers-gateways/EVG2000.aspx Product page]
[http://www.netgear.com/service-provider/products/routers-and-gateways/gigabit-ethernet-routers-gateways/EVG834N.aspx# Per ''NETGEAR'', this router was previously known as the ''EVG834N''.] :[http://www.speedguide.net/routers/netgear-evg834n-gige-wan-voice-gateway-with-80211n-282 EVG834N on '''SpeedGuide.net''']
EVG2000-BPAUS (Telstra) TA "100-14583-01R12" S/N "28E10274003F0" [http://www.ebay.com.au/itm/Netgear-EVG2000-/221270514140?pt=LH_DefaultDomain_15&hash=item3384c019dc ebay]
*This product was produced for a select few ISPs for use with their service. :It would appear the device is currently used by ''Telstra'' (Australia), ''Optus'' (Australia), and ''Tele2'' (Europe).
The default IP, login credentials, SSID, and everything else will depend on the device's branding. *For ''Tele2''.. :The default IP is 192.168.0.1 :The default login credentials are admin:tele2 :The default SSID format is '''Tele2GatewayXXXX''' *For ''Telstra'''s ''BigPond'' service (per [http://bc.whirlpool.net.au/bc/hardware/?action=h_view&model_id=1072 '''whirlpool.net.au''']) :The default IP is 10.0.0.138 :The default login credentials are admin:admin :The default SSID format is '''BigPondXXXX''' ::Per ''WiGLE'', upper case hex digits are used. ::There does not seem to be a relation between the digits and the BSSID.
==Additional external links== *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/netgear/evg2000 On the '''OpenWrt''' Wiki]
Per the images below and other sources, this device is using... *[[Broadcom]] BCM6369KPBG SoC @400MHz (BMIPS4350 v3.1) *''Macronix'' MX29GL128ELT2I-90G 16 MB Flash chip *either 2x ''Nanya'' NT5DS8M16FS-5T RAM chips (16 MB each, 32 MB total) :or 2x ''Winbond'' W9425G6JH-5 RAM chips (32 MB each, 64 MB total) <small>([http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/netgear/evg2000 per the '''OpenWrt Wiki'''])</small> *[[Broadcom]] BCM4322LKFBG 802.11n Wi-Fi radio *[[Broadcom]] BCM53115SKFBG GbE Switch chip *2x ''Silicon Labs'' Si3210-FM (Si3210) ''ProSLIC'' SLIC/Codec (VoIP) *20:4E:7F OUI
==Images== <gallery caption="internal"> File:evg2000-front-view.JPG|front view File:evg2000-backside-ram.JPG|bacside File:evg2000-ram-zoom.JPG|ram zoom File:evg2000-flash-chip.JPG|flash chip File:evg2000-all-parts.JPG|all parts File:Evg2000-jtag.JPG|jtag pinout File:Evg2000-spi.JPG|some important chip for openwrt </gallery>{{#set:Has images=internal}}
